X1: I pretty much never write reviews but I just HAD to say this thing is AMAZING!  It truly is the best purchase I've ever made.  I got it on sale as a deal of the day - I paid $174 and got a 3gen Echo Dot with it.  Worth every penny!  Are there more expensive models that do a better job?  Sure.  But for a first time robot vacuum purchase, this thing is great.  Does it clean in a random pattern?  Yes. Does it miss a spot once in a while?  Sure.  But if you run it enough it gets virtually every square inch of your floors that isn't a tiny nook in a corner.  It goes under all my couches and along the baseboards in my kitchen.I have very old wood floors in a rental (so I can't have them resealed myself) and sweeping them basically just pushes dirt around.  No more!  The first several times I ran this thing it picked up a terrifying amount of dirt.  The best thing is it picks up all the tiny particles of dirt that sweeping NEVER did.  I love being able to walk around barefoot again without feeling nasty floor dirt on my feet.  I cannot speak to how it works on carpet as I don't have any - but I would imagine this works best for wood/tile floors.Make sure you follow the directions for cleaning DEE BOT so you get the longest life out of it as possible.  Dump the container after every use.  Clean the outer filter 2x/week at least, and the inner filter 1x/week.  Clean the hair out of the brushes on the bottom as needed.  Sometimes it will eat things that make it freak out, just remove them from the brushes.I use my Echo Dots (I have several) to tell it to go clean and tell it to go home and charge, which is awesome.  Sometimes I use the remote to direct it to clean up specific messes - which is WAY easier to do, siting on the couch watching TV, than getting the broom/dust pan out and sweeping.  I use this the most for cat litter, which is picks up excellently.  I have the app but don't use it much, I don't find it necessary with Alexa/the remote.  You can set it on a cleaning schedule, but, I like to put all our chairs up before it runs, and I have to pick up all the cat toys.  If it encounters a cat toy it usually tries to eat it and gets stuck, but it doesn't ruin it or anything, just have to pull it out.  It gets stuck on the curtains sometimes, and it kind of slid over a 5" threshold into my office and cried for help.  You do have to rescue it sometimes, but it's so, so, so worth it.  Also, it will just shut off if it gets stuck on something and you don't respond to it's cries for help.  Our power went out in the middle of the night once and when it came back on it somehow activated DEE BOT.  I came down to a bunch of stuff pulled off my coffee table and was like.....this is really odd.  I found DEE BOT under my TV console tangled in a bunch of wires.  It didn't hurt anything and I was able to easily untangle it.  I'm going to get some wood cut at Lowes and put it under the TV area so DEE BOT can't reach the cords anymore - right now I'm using a mop to block the area.While this is a cheaper robot vacuum it is much better than a cheap one my friend bought.  Hers races around her house crashing into walls - this one DOES NOT.  It is very gentle and lightly bumps into things sometimes before turning.  We have two light-weight bikes in our living room and it glides around them easily without knocking them over.Bonus: I have HORRIBLE allergies I take antihistamines for daily.  I have a cat and I'm allergic to my cat.  It picks up ALL dust/cat hair with ease and has dramatically improved my allergies.  Why are you still reading this obscenely long review?? BUY IT!
X2: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2019

X1: My black cat is an incredible shedder! I literally have to vacuum every single day, often twice a day, to keep up with the amount of black hair my cat leaves on my white bedroom carpet, but who has time to pull out the vacuum twice a day? This little Deebot has been a sanity saver! It has a remote control, but a manual control on the appliance as well. I hit the "Go" button on the remote when I get up in the morning and by the time I'm dressed and ready for work, my bedroom carpet is clean! Sometimes when I come home in the evening, my carpet has wads of hair where she has rolled around and played, so I have to run it again, and by the time I'm changed out of my work clothes, the rug is good to go.The dirt storage compartment is so easy to pop out and empty! I thought it had an issue once, because it was rolling right over the hair, not picking it up, but then I realized the roller was full of hair. I had to manually clean the brush with my fingers, but it was easy and only took a few seconds.  Also, it's only happened a couple of times in the few months I've had it.I also bring it into other rooms of my house and let it run around and vacuum, while I clean. It's been great on my hardwood floors, so while I'm wiping down the counters, stove and washing dishes, it takes care of the floor for me!  I can't say it's good for deep cleaning, that hasn't been my purpose (I have a carpet cleaner for that) but for all of my carpet surface cleaning (dirt, hair, debris, etc) it's been excellent!This has been one of the best purchases I have made in a long time!  Saves me time and keeps my many pet lived in areas so much cleaner!

X1: I spent months researching and reading reviews on robot vacuums. I knew people who had iRobots, but I didn't want to spend that much money. I have twin toddlers and a dog who emits joy fluffs on a constant basis. After reading a few reviews on Amazon, one in particular ended up being our experience as well. We got one Deebot, we didn't pick up the area rugs and turned him on. We were amazed at how much he picked up, since we had swept just the day before. He easily avoided the stairs, he cleaned our area rugs, we have one low pile and the other a little longer. Our children are in love with it as well. They love watching him and try to decide where he's going to go. It also prompts them to pick up their toys, because they don't want Deebot to eat it. After three days we bought a 2nd one for our upstairs. We do have a thick rug in our children's room which my Shark has a problem with. Deebot did go over it, but when he tried to edge around it he got stuck. This was more than what I thought he was going to do and we easily pick it up for him. He goes under most of our furniture, we did have one couch that was low, which we got longer legs for, so we don't have to move it around for him to get under it. We love our Deebots and he does a great job cleaning up after our toddler's messes and the dog joy fluffs. If we run them every day we don't have to worry about emptying the collection tray mid-cleaning.

X1: This product is great and cleans our hardwood floor and miscellaneous area carpets (very low pile carpets).  I have owned this for over six months now and can say it does a great job of picking up the dirt, hair and dog fur (short haired dog).  This product was designed to work on the surfaces I have and the description was very clear that it will not work on other surfaces besides those described.  It works just as expected.  It does a great job of picking up the huge majority of everything we usually have on the floor.  While not a replacement for regular vacuuming and mopping, it sure cuts down on the mess.  It does a good job at getting into tight areas that aren't usually cleaned with a regular mop or vacuum.  The family loves watching it go around.  The dog is a little concerned with it invading her house, but keeps her distance.  It is easy to maintain and clean.  Only a couple of quirks encountered so far.  One is replacement brushes by the company on Amazon, don't seem to be the same size as the originals.  Two, when the power goes out the robot, if left on auto, will leave its docking station and start searching for it until the power comes back on.  That has lead us to searching the house for the robot when we returned home at the end of the day when the power had apparently been out for several hours.  Just seems odd that it needs the base station to be powered on all the time after it is docked.  Don't let those two minor things keep you from buying this robot.  It is a great value for the price and performs just as I expected, at a fraction of the price when compared to competitors.

We have my wife and two daughters with long hair and two dogs (1 sheds, 1 doesn't) and hardwood floors throughout. This thing does a good enough job that my wife has gone from vacuuming the floors every other day to maybe once a week! The only drawback is that the hair accumulates in the rolling wheel that causes an error. It also gathers on the spinning brush that causes an error. It also gets in the bumper and disrupts the sensor that causes an error. It's not that bad though...15-20 minutes cleaning the hair from the vacuum and it's back to work, error free. It detects the drop off to the back room without issue. It detects the large objects (fridge, cabinets, etc.) with no problem. It doesn't detect dining room chair legs very well and gently bumps into them but does not leave a mark or any dings. My wife and I are very surprised at just how well this little unit works! Absolutely perfect for us! Now the vacuuming gets done when no one is home and my wife has more time for other things.

X1: I've had some experience with robotic vacuums from bigger name brands in the past.  They mostly worked fine for a while, and before too long had components start to fail and batteries that wouldn't hold charge.  I've only had this vacuum for a few months now, but I'm blown away by it.  We only use it in our kitchen with linoleum floors, but its probably 250+ sq ft with a challenging geometry.Runtime:Battery life has been great.  We've seen 2+ hours on hard flooring.  I've tried timing the total runtime, but it's been so long that I've gotten bored and moved on to other things before it finished every time.Cleaning ability:The DEEBOT does a great job of removing everything from the floor.  We only run it about once a week, so the dust bin needs to be emptied after an hour or so of cleaning.  Having a larger dust bin would be nice, but it really does pack the dirt in there making an efficient use of the small space.Features:+Quiet operation.  Not nearly as loud as the previous robovac we had.  We can easily watch TV or listen to the radio in the next room.+Ease of use.  Press one button on the remote to clean.  Two buttons to return to home.-App support.  I haven't tried using the app as it requires permissions that I am not comfortable sharing for a Chinese made vacuum.  I'm not someone who is overly concerned about privacy, but I don't understand why a vacuum would be requesting the permissions it does.  Cannot comment on app functionality-The remote scheduling only allows setting one time, and it occurs every day.  It would be nice to be able say "vacuum every tuesday", but that is not possible without app support-Same goes for different cleaning modes.  The DEEBOT has an edge clean mode which will circumnavigate the the edges of the room making sure to deep clean areas that collect dust.  It is not possible to schedule edge clean mode with the remote.The positives far outweigh the negatives, and I highly recommend this vacuum to anyone thinking about jumping into the robovac arena.  We use one in the kitchen now, and when we finally install hard flooring in our sunroom we will definitely be getting a second one.  I wish I felt comfortable using the app so I could operate it through Alexa, but that really is a minor concern.  I'm just glad I don't have to get out the big vacuum and do this room by hand anymore.
X2: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2019

X1: I've had this thing for a while now, and with proper bristle maintenance this robot does a fantastic job at keeping my tile floors clean. Even gets over small lips in door frames to get into different rooms. If the area you want it to clean is massive, it's probably going to miss spots. Ensure you pick up all loose wires and small objects on the floor, or it could get stuck. The way I think it works is it cleans in all directions it can until its battery runs low. In my small apartment, it cleans everything for 2-3 hours in a half aimless, half articulated routine. I set it to go when I'm at work, and come home to a very clean floor. It's cleaner than I could ever have made it with a broom, I lack the patience to sweep for 3 hours straight. I have no pets or kids, though. This robot does not like wet floors, but it'll still clean them. It's not that loud for a robot, but it's not quieter than a running sink. I've only found it off its charger once; The power went out for half the day and it moved around and tried to find the IR signal the charger emits. If you cut power to its charger, it will begin to look for a powered charger until you tell it otherwise - until it dies.

X1: I. Hate. Cleaning. Anything that lessens my time spent sweeping, mopping, vacuuming or dusting is worth its weight in gold to me. I have a messy boyfriend, messy kid and a hairy fur-and-kibble-dropping dog, so before I bought this robot, I was constantly frustrated at how dirty my floors were, even immediately after I swept. I hated cleaning because - well, let's be honest here! - I seriously resented how my family would just waltz right on in, oblivious that I had just mopped or swept, with their muddy dirty shoes, or leave the door open for leaves and crap to blow in, or ignore the dog slobber drips and kibble crumbs and walk right through it instead of cleaning it up. While this vacuum can't really fix the wet messes - dog slobber, drips of soda, juice, wet sticky mystery substances, spaghetti sauce (ughhhh) - it handles just about everything else. (Maybe my next search should be to see if Ecovacs makes a mop-bot yet!)I bought this in July 2018, and have now had it almost a year. I purchased right before my floors were upgraded from bare, unsealed concrete (yes we really lived on that floor for years and it was awful) to wood-grain laminate. At first I was concerned that this might not pick tiny dust and dirt up from the concrete floor - but it did really well. Then, I was worried that the plastic sweeping brushes might cause static build-up and maybe wouldn't pick the fine dog hair up off the laminate flooring - but it surprised me. There doesn't seem to be any problem with static, even almost a year in.I have given this poor machine ZERO maintenance other than emptying the collection bin and occasionally pulling off the brushes and removing long strands of hair (mine) that have collected around the base. I have not even replaced the filters - I just take them outside once in awhile and give them a tap against a brick to knock some of the built-up dirt off. I wouldn't recommend this approach (you should definitely give it a little more care/maintenance than I have), but I am impressed with how well it has held up with zero effort. This poor robot has been kicked, pushed, and bumped many times and still continues to do its job with the same efficiency as always.It picks up my boyfriend's gross, coarse, long beard hairs (I cringe whenever I see them because they remind me of a different kind of body hair that, thankfully, he doesn't actually shed! LOL). It picks up the dog's short, straight hairs that usually stick to the floor with static electricity, as well as her fine undercoat that is now shedding after winter. It even picks up the inevitable hoardes of tiny little black ants that come inside in the Spring thru every crack and crevice searching for crumbs (even when there are none!)... and although I'm sure many of them just crawl out when the vacuum goes to dock for charging, I like to think that they die a dusty, slow death. I do seem to see fewer of them along my floors and baseboards after using this robot. It may just temporarily disrupt their little paths, but either way - death to house ants!Pros:- Inexpensive, compared to name brands like Roomba- Good quality for the price- Durable; has held up well with little to no maintenance- Convenient- Reduces my annoyance w my messy family!- As long as you run it regularly, it does a good job (not intended for heavily soiled areas)Cons:- Collection bin/tray is pretty small; must empty after each use (hope this company will eventually make one with the auto-empty bin like Roomba introduced last year!)- Kind of loud - definitely nowhere near as loud as a traditional vacuum, but still loud enough to annoy me when I'm watching TV or napping (so I tend to turn it on as I'm leaving the house - so I don't have to listen to it at all!)- Sometimes gets stuck under a certain piece of furniture that's just tall enough for the front bumper to get under, but not tall enough for it to move around (I could probably fix this by setting up a barrier but it doesn't happen that often)
X2: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2019

X1: March 2020 update. Well, I've given up. It's now just a $160 doorstop. It worked great for 6 months. Back in December I contacted customer support. Two of the three people who replied were obviously just giving me their rehearsed response. One actually responded to my issues. They had me do a reset which consists of holding the start button until it beeps 3 times, release that button, turn it off and on, then run as usual. It seemed to help after doing this many times. I think I had a week where it ran normally. Now that resent does not help at all and it is not picking up very well either. Since I gave up on it I let my husband take it apart. There were no clogs anywhere and nothing that looked like it could be repaired. So, lesson learned. I'm saving up for a Roomba.Dec. 2019 update. For the last month or so my beloved Dee has been stopping for no apparent reason. I keep this VERY clean. I empty the bin and clean the filters daily. I purchased extra filters so I can change them out and wash them. I also remove any fibers or hair that become entangled around the brushes. For the first 15-20 minuets it stops and beeps like it is caught on something, but it's not. After that it runs fine. I have to say I am very disappointed. It ran so well for the first 6 months.I have been using my Deebot for a few weeks now and I could not be happier! I read many reviews before purchasing and I believe I had realistic expectations of what this little machine could and could not do. This is the low end of the robot vacuum spectrum. It does not do room mapping. I think some of the negative reviews expected too much and should have bought a more sophisticated machine. I just wanted something to vacuum my hard floors all on 1 level, no stairs.I was a little bit concerned that my very dark floors would be a problem. But Dee has done well. My area rugs are also dark so it does not see a contrast there. Sometimes it gets on to the area rugs and sometimes it does not. But that's okay with me. I just want the dust and cat hair that float around the floors gone and it does a fantastic job. I do the rugs with a more powerful vacuum. About once a week I get into the areas that Dee can not. That was my plan. But now that Dee is sucking up all that dust and cat hair every day there is much less in the areas that are blocked off from it. As a bonus it gets under my china cabinet. I've been battling some very persistent spicers for years and Dee has been victorious! He gets the crumbs under the toe kick area of my kitchen cabinets, another constant battle. He also fits under my sofa and loveseat. My other vacuums do not. I had to move the furniture to get under those. If I want him to get under my curtains I tuck them up under the blinds that day. If not he cleans around them. Yes he bumps into things. This is how he finds his way around. He is suppose to do that. He has not damaged anything, even my newly painted white baseboards. His bumper works well. Often as he approaches a wall he detects it and turns around. I guess the contrast of my dark floors and white baseboards and light beige curtains are what lets him detect them. Although he has several settings I set a time so each day he does his work then finds his way back home. Yes, he sometimes gets stuck on something, but not often. I close doors to bedrooms and bathrooms. I just want my living, dining and kitchen floors done. He is more quiet than any of my other vacuums, yes I have a few. But it's a vacuum. It's not silent. I'll try to post a video soon.After using Dee for a few days I got out my cordless Hoover and vacuumed as usual. I bought the Hoover just for the hard floors when I had less of them. It has a great light on the front that shows dust I can not otherwise see. I was shocked at how clean my floors were. Dee is my hero. That Hoover is a rock star too, but that's another story. I still have to push it around which makes Dee my new best friend.These photos show Dee parked in my dining room, recharging after a hard day's work, how dark my floors are, and some areas he does not fit into. I did not expect him to morph into a 2" machine and vacuum around my tchotchkes. Guess I'm just nice that way. When company is coming I put him in the laundry room. I'm fine with his home in my dining room. It's very much out of the way and mostly unseen unless we are having company.I could ramble on even longer but I hope you get the idea. If you want room mapping and auto emptying buy a more expensive model. If you just don't want to have to vacuum your floors everyday hire Dee. He's worth every penny. Oh, he comes with his own remote control and you can download an app for your smartphone. I have enough apps on my phone. With this remote I see no reason to get the app. Or maybe I'm missing some added features with the app? I don't know. Happy less vacuuming everyone!

X1: I studied robotvacs for months before deciding on this one for 2 reasons. 1. I only expected her to run on my hardwoods and her reviews for that were great, 2. The price. So let me put her job into perspective. We have a little modest home about 1500 sq. ft. Of which only our 3 bedrooms are carpeted. We have 2 boys, a medium sized dog, and I have an in home daycare so add 6 more children, Mon.-Fri..For the first two weeks I only allowed her on the hardwoods, closing off the bedrooms because I didn't expect much of her on my carpets, and I have a Shark Vacume that I use for my good heavy duty cleaning. She has done amazing, running once to twice a day. Quiet enough to run during naptime, picks up all of the dog hair, sand from the sandbox, and grass clippings that are carried in on tiny feet that go in and out throughout the day, and the massive amount of crumbs that fall during Lunch/snack time. She even gets under my couch!!! I no longer have to swiffer under there, she gets it all.So after the first two weeks, and being confident in her abilities, I opened up my bedroom door to give her a try on my carpet. Now this isn't a deep cleaning vacuum. I still feel the need to break out my Shark Pro vacuum about once a week. But I will say she does a pretty darn good job. The first two times she ran under my bed (a spot I rarely am able to clean under) she filled up her dust bin. It was mind blowing what she was picking up.She now has free range over my house, runs about an hour and a half to 2 hours at a time. Now she is a little all over the place, there isn't a lot of logic to her cleaning, but I dont care. She manages to get to job done, and I didn't spend $400 on a robotvac!!! I love her!

X1: Bought two N79 units when Amazon had them on a promoted sale for §149. LOVE them! Did follow it around on first run to identify areas where it could choke on extension cords/wires/low clearances and re-positioned obstructions/interferences as needed. We have low-pile oriental rugs and wood floors, and raised lintels between rooms, and Deebot handled all of these fine with flying colors. There is a stairs down to family room and Deebot edge detection successfully avoided falling down the stairs. Ecovacs Android wifi app works good although Deebot goes offline sometimes so I am going to try repositioning my Eero wifi living room beacon and/or reposition Ecovacs charging station so that Ecovacs and Eero are closer to each other, but basically very happy with Ecovacs app too. Repositioning Ecovac closer line-of-sight did not fix this intermittent offline status in the Android app which causes app to lose contact with Ecovac for a few minutes now and then. So far that's my only qualm with this Ecovac N79S.  UPDATE:  I found that simply by navigating to "About" on the app somehow "wakes up" the app and gets the vacs to read "on-line" in the app, so the app problem is solved.UPDATE: I want to give this 6 stars because of they way the robot handles large objects that you would expect would jam it ... but they DON'T jam it !  Whenever I empty the dust bin of the ECOVACS N79S I find all kinds of large objects - 4 inch segements of rose stems, champagne metal cap, beer caps, large shards of glass (up to 1" across), sticks, small pebbles, small screws nuts and bolts (from work I was doing around house on electrical outlets) and NONE of these things on many vacuum runs has ever even once jammed up the robot ... and when I clean the robot dust bin I can just dump these large objects out of the vacuum robot ... they seem to just sit somewhere behind the dust bin but well away from the rollers and so therefore so far it seems nothing except a low clearance just slightly below the 3" this robot needs can stop this robot ... otherwise it just keeps going, and going, and going .....Our floors have never been so clean! Fun to have, family loves it, works great.

X1: I got this a few weeks ago, I had been wanting one for awhile. I was constantly vacuuming, I have a German Shepherd, 2 cats and then my daughter and I so there is literally hair everywhere.  My daughter decided it needed a name and Gerry was it. Gerry does a great job, I do empty him alot, but he does a lot of vaccuming. He goes under the couch, under, the dressers, ect. Absolutely amazing. I have this paranoia about letting Gerry work when we are not home, we've read the horror stories online about robo vacuums rynning over dog poo. So I only let him work while I'm here. It happen anyway though, my dog is well trained, but he does get sick on occasion today was one such day and I took Gerry apart and cleaned him. Lucky for me my dog ate a wipe, gross I know! But it made Gerry get stuck and he screamed for help (well he beeped) until I went to see what happen. The wipe got caught preventing the spread. My dog the night before had popped the child safetly lock on the the bathroom, which of course is to prevent him from going in there in order to get to the litter box and cat food. I guess he decided a wipe was a good idea too. Thankfully I had ordered some extra parts for Gerry and had them already. My one complaint about the design on this, which wont matter if you don't have children to spill things or pets to make messes is that when youbtakenit apart, all the electrical components are attached to the bottom. The bottom is what I needed to clean. Gerry is clean now and doing his job though, had he not got caught on something though I would have had poop spread about my house. Also we have a chair in the living room that Gerry gets stuck on daily. So there are definitely some cons for I'm happy, I no longer have German Shepherd hair balls blowing around my house if I don't vaccuming daily.

X1: Update TIP 1: Maybe it is just me, but I kept putting the filter box in the wrong way a dozen times. So, I placed a couple of stickers (you can use an address label) on the TOP part. Now, I get it right every time :) ...See my 1st picture.Update TIP 2: Someone asked about how much space the recharge needs. The booklet says it needs several feet on each side, BUT (see my 2nd picture), I was able to lay some old linoleum on the carpet for the unit to unite smoothly with the charger. You will see that it does not need a wide berth.I was one who thought a robot vacuum was a silly idea. I was vacuuming with my powerful Dirt Devil Jaguar Pet Vac about once a week. Each time, I would have to empty the canister two or three times.Then, BestBuy and Amazon had a price war during Mother's Day week of 2019. Both had dropped the price from around $249 to $159.  I had $50 in BestBuy gift cards doing E-Rewards surveys, so my cost was $109 (plus taxes).I figured if I didn't like it, I could give it away.I am hooked. After 4 days of daily cleaning, I noticed that the N79S was picking up less dirt. Then, I took my DareDevil Jaguar vacuum and did the whole house. This time, the canister was only HALF full. WOW! Now, I just do other stuff, like write this review, while the N79S hums along (not very noisy, unless you select power cleaning mode, which gets a bit louder, but not annoying).  And, you can select spot cleaning (it goes into concentric circles), or edge cleaning (it follows all the edges of a room/house), and more.The 4 stars for 'deep cleaning' is because the Dirt Devil Jaguar vacuum does a better job of sucking up trapped and deeper embedded sand/dirt at the carpeted area.PS, I noticed that it kept starting at midnight, until I read that you take the remote control and hold the Timer button (the top left, next to the round clock symbol, under the arrows) for a few seconds until it beeps or the Timer symbol on the remote screen disappears.Finally, the Jaguar Pet vacuum is now in hibernation :)  If you want to decide to get a robot vacuum, this one is a very good beginner's model.

X1: I've had this robot vacuum for about 3 weeks.  I like it, but there are a few concerns.  I came very close to returning the product, because I couldn't get it to work with my wifi.  I clicked on the link for support through Amazon, and they  tried to contact the supplier with no response.  They said they would continue to try, but I never heard back from them. .  What I realized is that it really doesn't need the internet .  It comes with a remote control that works very well and I have learned to love this option.  I have a very large house (1st floor about 2000 sq ft ) and it runs randomly.  It has very strong suction and if you use the remote option to clean the edges, it works most amazingly.  I am retired and at home most of the day, so if it misses a spot, I just redirect it with the remote.  When I empty the dirt container, I am amazed at how much it picks up.  It is also very quiet compared to my daughter's Roomba and that's exactly why I purchase this instead of a Roomba.  It is also smaller, so it fits nicely under beds, couches, and chairs.  I have many low nap area rugs  and hardwood throughout the house and it goes from one to the other without a problem.  It also goes over door strips and edges very well.  It does find the charger from time to time, but not always, so I just use the remote to direct it to the port if it can't find it.  Overall, I really like this product, but it is a shame that it doesn't have a better mapping feature.  For the price, it does a great job.

X1: I love this robot. We have four dogs and the hair gets a little out of control sometimes but this vacuum has definitely cut down on the time I have to manually vacuum. There are a couple things about it that maybe could be addressed and may not be a problem with other robot vacuums, but the biggest thing is the brush getting clogged up. By design, these don't hold much in the dust bin but it would be nice if it could sense when it was full and then stop. If it gets full then it just keeps going and the main brush gets overwhelmed with hair until it eventually shuts itself off and starts beeping at you to clean it out. If you stay on top of it and just empty the bin every so often (depending on the hair level of your house) then that isn't an issue. It's kind of a pain to have to clean the hair out of it because it gets so tightly wound around it. Emptying the bin is a 10 second job so I have certainly tried to remember to empty that out while the vacuum is working.A couple other things is the smart home control is great. I just tell Google to start it or dock it and it responds quickly and easily. I do find myself using the remote or the direction controls in the Ecovacs app to get a few spots that the vacuum occasionally missed but that is rare if you leave it to sweep the duration of the battery (which is roughly 90 minutes or so in my experience).Overall, a really great device to have in the house. Cuts down on your cleaning time exponentially and compared to other vacuums, is a great value. Highly recommended!

X1: We have only had this for a day and OH MY has it cleaned quite a lot.Dust bunnies under my sofa, corners of my hallways, pet dander and hair, etc. We like it a lot so far.Settings: I have used the 'room perimeter' setting the most so far. 'Auto' setting is fine, though it travels randomly without really cleaning a whole room 100% before moving on. The 'one room' setting doesn't really work well for me, as we have an open floor plan main level.Cleaning: This thing really does clean well. It gets hair, dust, pet dander, and so on. So far, I notice it doesn't suck up heavy particles like litter or food well. The litter it sucked up fell out a bit when I empty the suction compartment. Otherwise, no complaints.Robot intelligence: Being as this is our first robot vacuum, we are quite satisfied with it. It does have an app with several nice features (alarm, suction power, a direct remote control to 'drive') and it comes with a remote control. I can see why other people would opt for something smarter, as this little robot just kind of goes hither and yon, not exactly 100% cleaning one location before moving on.Overall: For me, this is a great addition to my cleaning regime. I'm always home so far when I use it and I'll set it in the bedrooms I need cleaned or do my best to adjust it when it needs.Issues: It has gotten stuck a few times on one of my shag rugs. It tries to 'right' itself, but as long as I'm home to help it out, no problem. Today it managed to get stuck under my couch, which was a first. But I'm learning to leave openings for it to get under.Tip: You MUST clean small items, electrical cords, etc. from the floor before using this, just like with a regular vacuum.We are very happy with out new little robot maid!

X1: I purchased my Deebot October, 2018 so I’ve had her for about seven months. She’s probably the best money I’ve ever spent and not much makes me happier than coming home and emptying her little bin and knowing the floor is clean and I basically did no work at all. I live alone- no kids, no pets- and she’s set to automatically run every day. I’m regularly surprised by how much she picks up, every single time she runs. Where the heck does she find all that dust and dirt??All that awesomeness aside, I’m writing this review now because little Alice (that’s what I named the vacuum) met with a major disaster this past weekend.A good friend is moving and I hosted a going away party for her. My friend and her husband came to my house and brought their Greyhound. The party was outside but Alice and the dog stayed inside. Late in the night, doggy daddy went inside to check on his dog and came back out in a bit of a panic.“How do you turn Alice off?”, he asked.I was a little confused because her automatic run time is set for 10am. He asked again, with a bit more urgency, “Seriously. How do you turn her off??”I go inside my house to find a horrific scene. The very large Greyhound has made a VERY large pile of very wet poo....and Alice has been trying to clean it up. I won’t go into the details of how far and wide the poo had been stretched across my house- but it was bad. Really, really bad.Cleaning the floor and baseboards took quite a long time and we were exhausted. Alice was in bad shape and I really figured she would end up in the vacuum graveyard. I wiped her exterior and wrapped her in a towel to deal with in the morning.The next day I began the task of trying to fix my beloved Alice. I took her apart- side brushes, main brush and filter off and tried to brush away all the poo. It was EVERYWHERE and my brush wasn’t doing any good. I was frustrated and Alice was filthy. In a last ditch effort of desperation, I took my kitchen sink sprayer to her.  I didn’t think she would possibly survive but I had to give her a chance.I dried her out with a hair dryer and let her sit for a couple hours. I put her on her charger and she lit up! Could it be possible she was going to work again? No way, I thought. 24 hours later, little Alice is happily cleaning my floor again. Like nothing ever happened. I don’t know what she’s made from but if you’re looking for a robot vacuum, I absolutely recommend the Deebot. I was already in love with my Alice but after this weekend I will tell every single person I know. Buy the Deebot!!! For the price, it absolutely cannot be beat in my book.

I’ve even found earrings and small toys inside while emptying it out. I have it programmed to run a few times a day so my floors stay nice and clean! It’s been able to vacuum my kitchen, living room and hallway multiple times on 1 charge.Cons: it’s gotten stuck a few times in my rug and from those 3 times the bristles are completely messed up and gone stray. It’s also a little noisier than I thought it would be. Lastly, a few times I’ve woken up to the Deebot in another room turned off because it got stuck on a carpet.Despite the cons I would recommend this product, it’s  great deal especially for the price!
